intro: Astracantha crenophila, commonly known as the crested sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, branched stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is typically low-growing, with leaves that are narrow and sometimes hairy. Astracantha crenophila is a member of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in desert gardens.
